News.headline: Dagenham and Redbridge Community Trust Project: PL Kicks
News.page_title: Dagenham and Redbridge Community Trust Project: PL Kicks
News.URL_keywords: Dagenham and Redbridge Community Trust Project: PL Kicks
News.short_description: Throughout this week leading up to our annual Daggers Against Racism day fixture against Guiseley this Saturday, we will be showcasing some of the projects that are run by our Community Trust
News.description:
Our Community Trust run a variety of different projects to local residents of Barking and Dagenham, one of those projects is 'PL Kicks'.

Our PL Kicks programme is funded by the Premier League Charitable fund which allows the young players of the project to attend free of charge.

At present the Dagenham and Redbridge FC Community Trust run 3 PL Kicks session per week, we hold sessions at Goals Soccer Centre in Dagenham every Thursday and Friday from 5:30pm – 7:30pm and a female only session at Eastbury School every Friday from 4:30pm – 6:30pm.

The sessions are aimed for young players of all abilities aged 12 – 19 years of age and provides a safe, enjoyable environment for the young people of the community to play football.

There is no need to book in advance, just turn up and play for free!

For full details of our annual Daggers Against Racism Day please click here
